events.name: Android Study Jam
events.description:
Please join GDG PDX for an Android Study Jam.  This will help beginners get started on Android and will be based on the Udacity Android for Beginners course.

This will also be the inaugural meeting of GDG PDX so please come and join us for great talk on Google technologies, Android and network.  Pizza and soda will be provided.
events.how_to_find_us: We're on 5th street between Columbia and Clay

events.name: Applied Material Design
events.description:
For our second event, we're going to do a deep dive on Material Design and how it works in real applications.

Expert Android Developer and UI tech guru Larry Mckenzie along with Designer Extraordinaire Sam Roberts will be speaking on the subject. Food and drinks will be provided.

events.name: Google I/O Extended
events.description: Join us at the eBay Community Lounge to view the Google I/O 2016 keynote and sessions live!

events.name: Google I/O Recap
events.description:
For those who can't make the I/O extended event, or who just can't get enough of the goodness that Google will be releasing, we'll be doing an I/O recap.  We will discuss highlights of the content released during this year's Google I/O presentation.  We'll have several speakers, including yours truly, who attended Google I/O who will present the material and be available to dive into any subject you bring questions on.

As always, food and drink will be provided, hope to see you there!

events.name: All about Kotlin!
events.description:
This month we're going to discuss Kotlin!  If you haven't heard of Kotlin, it's a new language created by JetBrains (the people behind the people behind Android Studio).  Kotlin is 100% compatible with java and android, and can be used in existing android projects mixed with java classes.  There is incredible IDE support and the language itself is very modern, borrowing many concepts from functional languages such as Scala, but being much more accessible to java developers.

We will have a presentation about Kotlin basics and I encourage you to bring laptops to play with it as we will reserve some time for group work where we all play with the language together.

If you want to participate in that portion of the meetup, please have Android Studio installed along with the Kotlin plugin.  

Details of Kotlin can be found at:

http://kotlinlang.org/

As always, excellent food and drink will be provided by our generous sponsor, eBay

events.name: Cloud Computing with Google Cloud
events.description:
Come and explore Cloud Computing with Google Cloud. 

We will show you how to do: 

 • Spin up instances and auto-scaling instance groups 

Run a website with a front-end load balancer and multiple web servers 

 • Create, mount, format and snapshot disks 

 • Create a Docker container cluster and run your app in Docker environment 

 • Monitor your infrastructure, containers, apps, logs all from one place

We're privileged to welcome Obulapathi Challa to speak to us.  Obulapathi is an expert on Google Cloud technologies.  He recently moved to Portland from St. Louis where he was the organizer of that city's GDG chapter.

Excellent food and drink will be provided by our generous sponsor: eBay.

events.name: Scalable Android Development - How to test
events.description:
So you've got an app in the play store!  Congratulations!  How do you keep updating your app to add new features, account for platform updates and respond to your users?  

If you've ever been part of a development team that said "we have to re-write that to add any more features", this talk is for you.  We will dive  into strategies to architect your application for testability and techniques for testing your app.  

We'll discuss the uses of jUnit tests, UI tests, BDD, cucumber, espresso and mocking. 

Food and drink will be provided by our generous sponsor, eBay.

events.name: Introduction to Machine Learning (with Google Cloud ML APIs)
events.description:
If you are planning to jump the Machine Learning bandwagon, wait no more! In this introductory ML meetup, we will explore how to use Machine Learning using Google Cloud ML APIs. Here are some fun things we will show how to do using the ML API's: 

* Understand the content of an image: Classify images into thousands of categories (e.g., "sailboat", "Eiffel Tower"), detect individual objects and faces within images, and find and read printed words contained within images. 

* Convert audio to text: Recognize over 80 languages and variants, to support your global user base. Transcribe the speech into text to enable use cases like command-and-control through voice. 

* Learn the structure and meaning of text: Extract information about people, places, events and much more, mentioned in text documents, news articles or blog posts. You can also use it to understand sentiment about your product on social media or parse intent from customer conversations happening in a call center or a messaging app.

events.name: GDG Retrospective / Holiday Party
events.description:
In honor of the holidays, we're going to do a very low key meetup this month.  We're not going to have any prepared content, but instead spend this meetup to get feedback from the community on how the first year of GDG PDX has gone, as well as celebrate with food and drinks.  

Please come with any ideas, requests or feedback you have, or just come to have a few drinks and some food.  This will be our last meetup of the year, since the last Tuesday of December is way too close to Christmas.  We'll talk a little bit about what we're looking forward to in the upcoming year as well.

events.name: Android Studio: whats new & tips and tricks
events.description:
If you develop Android applications, you spend a lot of time using Android Studio.  This is an incredible IDE built on top of the top notch IntelliJ IDEA.  Google has devoted huge resources to developing and enhancing Android Studio over the last few years, and knowing it inside and out can enhance your productivity.

In this meetup, we'll go over some of the new features which have been introduced in the 2.x versions of Android Studio, and go over some tips and tricks which can be used in Android Studio to make development a breeze.  

Please bring your own favorite functions as well and we'll have time set aside for community members to share their favorite features.  

As always food and drink will be provided by our generous sponsor, eBay.

events.name: Introduction to Machine Learning with TensorFlow and Google Cloud
events.description: Let's meetup and learn about TensorFlow and Cloud ML. In this workshop, you will learn that Machine Learning is easy (trust me on this!), you will write a simple machine learning model in Python using TensorFlow and run it on Google Cloud (and locally on laptops as well). In order to most out of this workshop please bring your laptops with Docker installed and create a free Google Cloud account (Instructions at https://cloud.google.com/free-trial/).

events.name: Develop with Polymer, Google's Web Components
events.description:
Our speaker this month will be Alexis Ménard, Web Platform Architect at Intel.

Web Components launched a new web development era based on custom elements that extend the HTML grammar. With Web Components, you can create reusable custom elements that interoperate seamlessly with the browser’s built-in elements, or break your app up into right-sized components, making your code cleaner and less expensive to maintain. 

Polymer is Google's lightweight library that helps you take full advantage of Web Components. Polymer makes it easier and faster to create anything from a button to a complete application across desktop, mobile, and beyond.

In this presentation we will talk about web components, how they work, and we will introduce Polymer and how to get started with it, even in an existing project. Finally we'll cover some of the best features of Polymer to get you productive and efficient.

Food and drinks will be provided by our generous sponsor: eBay

Please note, we will be meeting one week earlier than normal this month

events.name: I/O Extended - Downtown PDX
events.description:
GDG PDX will be hosting an I/O extended event. We'll be streaming the events live on big screens. eBay is opening our large community lounge for you to hang out, see what's new and discuss it with your fellow GDG'rs. Whether you can hang out all day or only stop by for an hour, we hope to see you there!

*Note, due to a scheduling conflict, this extended event will only be open the first 2 days of I/O.

events.name: Google I/O Recap
events.description:
We'll go over the most exciting announcements from Google I/O 2017. Come chat with your fellow GDG'rs about what you found most exciting! 

More details to be added after I/O. 

If there are any subjects you see during the event you'd like to see us focus on, please comment in this meetup and I'll try to get additional information on them.

Food and drinks to be provided by our generous sponsor, eBay.

events.name: Build a custom image classifier using TensorFlow
events.description:
Interested in building a custom image classifier for classifying your friend's pictures or your cat/dog pictures or pictures of products of your company? Come and learn how to build one using TensorFlow. We will be using Inception V3 model for classifying custom images. We will also discuss Transfer Learning,  a technique to leverage previously trained models to make the task of Deep Learning on custom datasets easy. 

Please fell free to bring your custom image datasets and we will guide you step by step to build a classifier to classify your images. In order to most out of this workshop please bring your laptops with Docker installed.

Food and drinks will be provided by our generous sponsor, eBay.

events.name: Nest Demo Night at Google
events.description:
For July we are holding our Meetup at a special time and date! We're fortunate to have Thomas Devaux from Nest hosting at Google's building here in PDX.

From Thomas:

Did you know Nest has a (tiny tiny) presence in Portland? Few more Nest engineers from the Apps team will be visiting that week, so we thought it would be the occasion to present some of the cool stuff we do at Nest.

Few of the topics we’d cover (agenda might change a bit):
- Presentation of Nest Products
- Case study: focus on the Nest App and some challenges we’re facing
- Works-With-Nest API: let’s build an app that interacts with Nest
- Hands-on demos, Q&A
- Raffle!

Agenda:
- 5pm to 6pm: drinks in the lobby (4th floor)
- 6pm: building doors close
- 6pm - 7pm: Presentation from the Nest Apps team
- 7pm to 8ish: Q&A / Happy Hour / Hands-on demo / Raffle

Notes:

The building doors close at 6pm, after which you'd need a badge. Please arrive before 6, and get to 4th floor. We won’t have an easy way to let you in after 6 (if you’re stuck - reach out to Thomas, Romain, our numbers will be on signs in the lobby). Space is limited to 40 people, please only RSVP if you actually plan to come.

Food / drinks to be provided.

events.name: What's Revolutionary about Flutter
events.description:
We have special guest speaker Wm Leler who works for Google on their mobile development framework, Flutter (see https://flutter.io)

Flutter is a new mobile app SDK to help developers and designers build modern, beautiful mobile apps for iOS and Android.

Find out what is new and exciting about Flutter.

Food and drinks will be provided by our generous sponsor, eBay.

events.name: Bringing VR to the web with WebVR
events.description:
This month our speaker will be Alexis Ménard who will bring us a topic on the cutting edge of web technology.

Virtual and Augmented Reality are gaining momentum amongst consumers, especially with the release of cheaper VR and AR entertainment solutions. One of the main challenges for AR/VR these days is content delivery which requires giant downloads and complicated app store installation steps, and often involves proprietary stacks which lock users to a particular vendor. Leading VR/AR companies have spent significant resources to create content yet it didn’t proliferate because it was cumbersome for developers to go to market: multiple vendors, multiple SDKs and the need for extensive skillsets. 

WebVR is a way to address this challenge. It leverages the power of the web platform -- low friction, discoverability, indexing and an open and easy development environment -- to help deliver rich and entertaining portable experiences. The web doesn’t pose gatekeepers -- you can deploy or instantly update a virtual or augmented reality experience on your website. 

WebVR allows developers to easily create virtual experiences that can be seamlessly deployed across different operating systems and browsers without compromising capabilities. In this presentation, we’ll introduce WebVR, its scope and the current status of standardizing the API, and then show how you can create a VR or AR experience quickly using the web platform.

events.name: WebVR, VR for the Web Take 2
events.description:
Alexis Ménard will be following up on his excellent introduction to WebVR:

WebVR allows developers to easily create virtual experiences that can be seamlessly deployed across different operating systems and browsers without compromising capabilities. In this presentation we're going to follow up from the previous WebVR presentation and build a VR demo using Three.JS and A-Frame. This will be a interactive session with live coding.

Food and drinks will be provided by our generous sponsor: eBay

events.name: Tell great data stories with Data Studio
events.description:
• What we'll do
Come and explore how to tell great data stories to support better business decisions using Google Cloud Data Studio. Google Data Studio turns your data into informative dashboards and reports that are easy to read, easy to share, and fully customizable. Dashboarding allows you to tell great data stories to support better business decisions. Easily access all the data sources you need to understand your business and make better decisions. Transform your raw data into the dimensions, metrics, and calculations you need — no code or queries required. Harness the collective wisdom of your team. Share and collaborate in real time. Work together quickly, from anywhere.

• What to bring

• Important to know

events.name: Progressive Web Apps: Apps for the Next Billion Users
events.description:
• What we'll do
The web is increasingly becoming part of our daily lives, and many of the common tasks we perform from day to day are built as web experiences, including gaming, banking, shopping, and socializing with our dearest friends and family. In some countries, the web and mobile web is the only place to consume content: network coverage is unreliable, data plans are expensive and good hardware is very expensive. Downloading and updating large applications from the store is an option people often disregard.

Progressive Web Apps are designed to solve these three problems: they are fast, reliable, engaging and they are quite small, and only updates when the user is interacting with them.

PWAs provides you with all you would expect from a native application but right from your browser, no installation required. Friction is minimal and they can get all the benefits of a native app such as icon on your home screen, reliable offline operation, push notifications.

In this presentation we will cover the core concepts of Progressive Web Apps. We will also touch on related topics to make an even better Progressive Web App experience.

Topics covered: ServiceWorker, Manifest, Push Notifications, Web Share

• What to bring

• Important to know

events.name: Firebase: The Cloud on Mobile
events.description:
With users demanding more of their mobile phones every year, developers bear the burden of having to do everything at once — from building REST APIs and a backend to handle them, to crafting seamless mobile experiences. Firebase lets you focus on building the features that set you apart from the competition as opposed to all the infrastructure supporting them. The “develop” products in Firebase aim to eliminate the need for custom backends by providing authentication, databases, and storage. Once you’ve shipped your app, the “stability” and “grow” products help you catch errors in production, analyze your users, and find ways to optimize your their experience.

This presentation will give a brief overview of the Firebase platform and dive deep into a few core products with real-world examples to light the way.

Alex Saveau is a firebase expert who has worked directly with Google on implementing their new technologies. Please join us to see his excellent presentation and learn how to get the most of the new tools Firebase makes available to application developers.

Food and drinks will be provided by our generous sponsor: eBay

events.name: Intro to Actions on Google Assistant
events.description: Every decade or so we have big shift in technology that add to our we develop and how users interact with technology. The newest shift is to conversational interaction with intelligent assistants. Learn how you can create your own apps which can provide a conversational interface and be accessed by Google Assistant - found in every Android phone and Google Home device.

events.name: An Intro to Cloud AutoML Vision
events.description:
Have you been thinking about checking out Google’s new Cloud AutoML Vision service? Are you interested in what AutoML can do for you and where you should use it? Then join us!

Jerry Hargrove from Lucidchart will introduce and explore AutoML Vision
features and capabilities and how they can be used to build a working image classification system.

He'll provide a brief introduction to the Google Cloud artificial
intelligence (AI) family of services and an overview of the AutoML
services, with special focus given to AutoML Vision.

Then, he'll cover collecting and curating training images in order to train
an accurate classifier, and how the quality and quantity of training images
impact the accuracy of the resulting AutoML model.

Finally, he'll talk about how to use Google Cloud Storage to build a static
website to host the web application and how to use Google Cloud Functions to act as a gateway to the AutoML model.

Light dinner to be provided by our generous sponsor: eBay.

events.name: Flutter: why you and your company should try it
events.description:
Note: this event will be held on Thursday rather than our normal Tuesday due to a scheduling conflict on our space.

Wm Leler - Google Developer Advocate for Flutter

You have probably heard about Flutter, but maybe you haven't tried it yet. Or you have tried it but don't know enough about it to convince your company (or clients) to use it for a project. This talk will bring you up to speed on the state of Flutter, showing you some of the wonderful apps that have been built with it by major companies, and doing some live coding with Flutter to show it off.

This event is sponsored by eBay, food will be available.

events.name: GDG PDX Holiday Party!
events.description:
Please join us for our GDG PDX Holiday party! This is a chance to connect with the other members of the GDG community and enjoy some holiday festivities. Please come with ideas and topics you'd like to see us address in 2019 and with ideas on how we can improve.

Food and drink will be provided, including adult drinks for our over 21 members.

Looking forward to seeing you all!

events.name: VR and AR on the web with WebXR
events.description:
Please join our presenter Alexis Menard for a talk about W3C WebXR Device API, the JavaScript specification to support VR and AR on the web.

In this presentation we will introduce WebXR and how it helps you to create immersive experiences for the web. We will cover the basics of the API, how you can get started and we will dive into samples of code both for AR and VR. Finally we'll talk about the status of the specification and how you can use it today.

Food will be provided by our generous sponsor: eBay

events.name: CI as Smooth as Flutter
events.description:
Please join Mikhail Tokarev, Devops engineer at Nevercode for this joint meetup being run in cooperation with FlutterPDX - https://www.meetup.com/FlutterPDX/

Let’s talk about out of the box CI solutions for your Flutter projects. Codemagic is a free dedicated CI/CD service for Flutter. It was announced during Flutter Live in December 2018 and has been growing and innovating ever since. Mikhail Tokarev will demonstrate how to set up and configure workflows in Codemagic for publishing your Flutter apps to the app store and play store. Tips and custom scripts that showcase how developers have been using Codemagic will also be covered and you will learn how to use different flavors in deployment.

Mikhail has worked as devops engineer for over 5 years. He is passionate about introducing devops practices into the development process in different teams. He joined Nevercode over a year ago and now leads architecture design of both Nevercode and Codemagic. He first saw Flutter in 2018 after Droidcon in Berlin and is excited about helping mobile developers around the world with seamless CI/CD experiences.

Light food and soft drinks will be provided by our generous sponsor: eBay

events.name: Google I/O'19 Extended
events.description: Please join other tech enthusiasts and GDG PDX for Google I/O Extended Viewing Party. We will open our community lounge from 9:30-5 daily and live stream sessions from I/O.

events.name: Google Cloud Run - Hands on Lab
events.description:
Please join John Hanley, Google Cloud Platform GDE, who has come down from Seattle to run a hands-on talk on Google Cloud Run. This will be a combination of presentation and hands-on lab. At the completion of this meetup, everyone will walk away having created their first Cloud Run service!

Cloud Run is a managed compute platform that enables you to run stateless containers that are invocable via HTTP requests. Cloud Run is serverless: it abstracts away all infrastructure management, so you can focus on what matters most — building great applications. For more information, see https://cloud.google.com/run/

This is a hands on event, please be sure to bring your laptop and create your GCP account in advance! Please also have git and Python 3.x installed on your laptop.

Light food and drink will be provided by our generous sponsor, eBay.

events.name: Getting Started with Sceneform and ARCore
events.description:
Please join GDG PDX for a talk on adding 3D to your android apps using Sceneform by Morgan Lutz of Kiva.

Sceneform makes adding 3D and AR experiences to your project a breeze. Learn how set up your project with the Sceneform plugin, import and modify the different supported 3D model types, and load your 3D model into a custom view or an AR experience.

Food and beverages will be provided by our generous sponsor, eBay.

group_profile.intro: I'm Jake Hall.  I'm a mobile developer by profession and long time Portland resident.
